# Arpeggio: add4 in B (Shape: D)

---

## Brief Description
This arpeggio is a B major arpeggio with an added 4th note (E) which is played in the D shape on the guitar. It adds a colorful and unique sound to the traditional B major arpeggio by incorporating the 4th note into the pattern.

## Notes and Intervals

- B (Root)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- E (Added 4th)

The intervals in this arpeggio are Root - Major 3rd - Perfect 5th - Added 4th.

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is often used in genres like rock, pop, and jazz where musicians want to add a touch of sophistication and color to their chord progressions or solos. The added 4th note creates a sense of tension and release that can evoke different emotions depending on how it is used in the music.

## Songs That Use this Arpeggio
1. **"Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin:** The iconic guitar solo in this classic rock song features arpeggios with added notes, and this arpeggio in B (Shape: D) could be heard in various parts of the solo.
   
2. **"Smooth" by Santana ft. Rob Thomas:** This Latin rock song incorporates intricate guitar work, and arpeggios with added notes are commonly used throughout the track to create a rich harmonic texture.
   
3. **"All Blues" by Miles Davis:** In the realm of jazz, this arpeggio can be applied in improvisational contexts, and "All Blues" is a notable example where musicians experiment with various arpeggios to create interesting melodic lines.

These songs showcase how the B add4 arpeggio in the D shape can be utilized across different genres to enhance the musical composition.
